dogecoin.text:
@nastyoldmrpike @jonatanpallesen @primalpoly @billmaher No there are only 3 cryptocurrencies

- Bitcoin
- Dogecoin 
- Cumrocket

I know this because I read an article

@pandatress Dogecoin trading is basically a game of patience. 

Wait till everyone forgets about it ...
(Dogecoin spoils over time. Maybe Doge is like grain or food in times past; you can't stockpile it indefinitely, so you are forced to use it socially - throw feasts etc)

Bitcoin is gold (store of value, fixed supply, few transactions most of which are large)

Eth is bonds for the "Ethereum Nation". 

What's silver? 

Hard to say, but basically a bunch of old coins with enduring appeal; Litecoin, Dogecoin (though doge isn't really a metal...)
@SumElseThing1 They're buying it on Robinhood AFAIK. That's an IOU for dogecoin. Even I never held any doge. I only held IOUs for it on Binance and Kraken.

(3) #Dogecoin = Food/grain

A store of value that perishes over time. Good for parties, good for the good times. Dogecoin inflation is about 5% per year, but taking lost coins into account it might actually be more than that as a percentage.
The dogecoin chart against BTC .... https://t.co/Os1QX53TId
Examples: Dogecoin with SNL highlighted https://t.co/MguC8Yrx8J

Shorted $DOGE down from 58 cents to 50. Nice little gain with the bear token. I think at this stage, you short every rally. 

I'll buy doge eventually, but these levels are not sustainable IMO.
Turns out it didn't, closed out for a small loss earlier today, now shorting $DOGE.

Listened to this, I agree with @zhusu on most points, including the possibility that dogecoin could replace bitcoin as the top "old-fashioned" cryptocurrency, at least temporarily. 

I called that in January

Now, what are the implications of this? Elon perhaps doesn't know wtf he's talking about. In a few weeks someone educates him, and he dumps Dogecoin. 

Assuming that doesn't happen, we now have two PoW cryptocurrencies (Doge and BTC) competing for the PoW spot.

Low information marketplace, actual understanding doesn't seem to do much good. 

Elon is working to improve $DOGE. OK.

@themachinebuilt I want more dip 

I want Dogecoin in the 30s

@orthonormalist The worst pwn is when I sold Dogecoin at 7-10 cents. 

The other mistake I made was entering into EthMaxi land a bit too much. If you trade, you have to be very good at knowing when to update your beliefs....

@sam_throne If Elon has any sense he'll just completely re-do it as a PoS crypto and allow people to exchange PoW doge for the new PoS $DOGE. 

The technical side of $DOGE is utter dogshit.

@sam_throne Once more people know about Dogecoin than Bitcoin, Doge will actually have the better narrative.

All that's needed is for Elon to clean up the technical side, kill the inflation, delete the whales and make nice user-interfaces/apps.

@nic__carter - Dogecoin is magically better than bitcoin 

- There's no such thing as tradeoffs 

Apes will pump doge and institutions will dump BTC

It's pretty unfair, but this is not a good time to hold BTC https://t.co/hyi1e0N0qN

You are not early to #Bitcoin. The best case scenario for bitcoin is not that good. The worst case is really bad, and the sustainability narrative just made things a lot worse. 

Dogecoin is basically ElonMuskCoin at this stage. Very volatile, but the upside is extreme.

#Ethereum is IMO a safer investment than $BTC. 

$DOGE has a lot of upside but you really could lose 100% of your investment on Doge. 

Ethereum is getting institutional adoption, fairly safe gains IMO. 

#NotFinancialAdvice
#Dogecoin holders please panic sell so I can get in cheap

Right now, the market cap of Bitcoin is largely determined by institutional buying.

Ordinary Bitcoin holders stand to lose 90% or more if institutions pull out and favor Dogecoin as the store of value. 

Institutions will follow the crowd, and the crowd is heading to $DOGE.

The problem for BTC holders is that in blockchain, these technical factors aren't much of a moat. Blockchain value is mostly determined by psychology. 

Bitcoin is only valuable because people believe that it's valuable, and if that belief flips to Dogecoin then ... 😬

So much misinformation here: fundamentally, $DOGE is worse than $BTC.

Its faster block speed and lower fees come at the cost of security and decentralization, and over time the fees will go up as it gets more adoption.

#Dogecoin flipping #Bitcoin would show that the value in cryptocurrencies is determined by social consensus, not mathematics or code.  

Middle curve is about to be very heavily punished....

@CkLorentzen It has to credibly be a one-off thing and I think Dogecoin transitioning from a joke to the Elon Musk Crypto is a reasonable place to give a haircut to the biggest whales, which they might even voluntarily agree to as they will make money overall.
@tiffa31 @elonmusk @neuralink People are going to get slaughtered on Dogecoin.

@Witsofire I have a bull thesis for dogecoin to $10 or even $100, but with Elon acting like this it is invalidated and I sold my remaining 750 doge that I accumulated.

I'm still prepared to bid on it in the sub 10-cent range for a long-term hold.

@Witsofire Dogecoin is only worth holding at these prices if you put your faith in Elon turning it into something new. 

Over the past few days he's demonstrated that he doesn't understand crypto and has nuked his credibility with the rest of the crypto community.
@O__C___D__ #Dogecoin's strategy: https://t.co/wU6lUR3zwI

I'm sorry but the #Dogecoin shitshow is over now. 

I've sold at a small profit. 

I don't think Elon has a plan. If he had a plan, he wouldn't be acting like this and losing credibility. 

#Dogecoin back down to sub 10 cents please.

The #Dogecoin #apes somehow found GitHub... 

Imagine being a developer right now lol https://t.co/suTAXBXqV1

Given @elonmusk's recent tweets I'm not looking to buy $DOGE at these levels. 

I don't think this is 4D chess, I think it's just Elon not knowing what the fuck is going on. 

Price-wise, the only outcome I can see medium-term is downside for $DOGE.

I think the endgame for Elon will be that he launches a proof-of-stake clone of Dogecoin and uses his clout to brand it as the real Dogecoin, and allows people to burn old $DOGE for his new one, except he'll ban the whale wallets.

Litecoin, Dogecoin etc will find a use-case of some kind and go to PoS. Holders will get yield, miners will go out of business. 

Nobody actually wants to pay for mining if they don't have to, they'd far rather take the money as a staking yield.

- normies will buy Dogecoin
- institutions will buy Ether

No buyers = price collapse. 

The question is just how long this takes to play out.

The environmentalism FUD against Bitcoin will help, even though it's not a great argument. 

If Elon pumps Dogecoin and keeps it on PoW that will hurt more.

Who will be buying BTC?

My target for #Bitcoin is 0.5 Eth 

I'm not going to make long-term buys until then. 

#Dogecoin is less clear, but I want to see pain and panic before I buy. 

I suspect the panic level is just under 20 cents. I'm OK to wait.

Instead of asking "what is a smart contract?", the important question is "will this make Dogecoin moon?".

Mewn > fundamentals. 

https://t.co/gezJulEHdN https://t.co/T1Aj2MOLXi
@0xtuba Dogecoin defi

I also told people to start dollar cost averaging in January. DCA over a time period of years and you'll do OK. 

I also called: 

- Dogecoin at 1 cent 
- Matic at 11 cents 

Not bad for my first crypto run.
